bug.cf_doc_type: If docs needed, set a value

long_desc.thetext:
[root@3248389fe489 ~]# docker-compose up Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 654, in _build_master ws.require(__requires__) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 968, in require needed = self.resolve(parse_requirements(requirements)) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 859, in resolve raise VersionConflict(dist, req).with_context(dependent_req) pkg_resources.ContextualVersionConflict: (requests 2.13.0 (/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages), Requirement.parse('requests!=2.11.0,<2.12,>=2.6.1'), {'docker-compose'})
During handling of the above exception, another exception occurred:
Traceback (most recent call last): File "/usr/bin/docker-compose", line 6, in <module> from pkg_resources import load_entry_point File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3036, in <module> @_call_aside File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3020, in _call_aside f(*args, **kwargs) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 3049, in _initialize_master_working_set working_set = WorkingSet._build_master() File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 656, in _build_master return cls._build_from_requirements(__requires__) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 669, in _build_from_requirements dists = ws.resolve(reqs, Environment()) File "/usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/pkg_resources/__init__.py", line 854, in resolve raise DistributionNotFound(req, requirers) pkg_resources.DistributionNotFound: The 'requests!=2.11.0,<2.12,>=2.6.1' distribution was not found and is required by docker-compose
python3-requests-2.13.0-1.fc26.noarch docker-compose-1.11.1-2.fc26.noarch
Looks like we need to just require 'requests' and hope for the best.
I really hope this is the last thing which blocks having compose 1.11 for F26.
Michael, I just applied for commit access -- can solve problems like these in future myself so you don't have to worry.
This bug appears to have been reported against 'rawhide' during the Fedora 26 development cycle. Changing version to '26'.

Sorry Tomas, I was confused and misread your comment to mean that you would solve this problem and I didn't need to do anything.
I've pushed 1.11.1-3 which should finally be working. I am able to run the docker-compose example successfully with it on rawhide.

I'm sorry for the confusion. I would have solve it if I got the commit rights :) https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/docker-compose/
So the question is: would you like me to help you with maintenance?
Can confirm the newest build works. Well done!!

(In reply to Tomas Tomecek from comment #5) > I'm sorry for the confusion. I would have solve it if I got the commit > rights :) https://admin.fedoraproject.org/pkgdb/package/rpms/docker-compose/ > > So the question is: would you like me to help you with maintenance?
Yes, thank you! I think I approved the pending ACLs correctly. Strangely I don't recall receiving an email about it. It's also possible I got an email and didn't understand it...
> Can confirm the newest build works. Well done!!
Thanks. I'll go ahead and close this and we can go find some new bugs!
